Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: shareesmiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on March 31st 12' and checked out on April 1st 12'. At first glance it seems like a nice Hotel with a nice Lobby. We stayed here with it being so close to the Space Needle. Any how it all started with the check in. We went in to check in at 3pm and they were not ready to give us keys for another hour. Then when they gave us keys they DID NOT work. They said we will be right up with new keys, about 45 minutes later after we called them again, they brought some up and those keys didn't work either. Then about 10 minutes later they finally got us a set of keys that worked. The customer service was AWFUL. To make matters worse when we checked out the next day I accidentally left some souvenirs I had bought for my Husband and Daughter in one of the dresser drawers. I called that same night and talked with the lady at the front desk who assured me that no one had checked into the room we stayed in. So, one would think that they items were either still in the drawer or like the lady at the front desk said, they might be in the lost and found. She instructed me to call in the morning to talk with the head of Housekeeping, Mario. I called and left messages and had to call several times to track him down. When I finally got through, he said he must be having problems with his phone because he didn't get any of my messages. So, he says to me I will call you right back after I check the lost and found and check with my housekeepers. Never got a call back. I called again the following morning, he said he checked everything and didn't see it anywhere. I had to speak with the Customer Service Manager who was no help and miscommunication everything, at least he apologized and said he takes full responsibility for it. Then I spoke with the General Manager Brandy, who said she would go to the Space Needle and buy the items that were taken and I could pick them up there. I preferred to get them myself because I was afraid she wouldn't get exactly what I had bought. Sure enough, when I went to pick up the items, it was the wrong coffee beans and the wrong cup.....I wanted to cry! She had a nice gesture in buying an extra pound of coffee beans for all the hassle, but the whole point of this whole situation is the principle of it. I know that the housekeeper had to have either taken or thrown away my things. When I I was explaining to Brandy that she needs to keep a better eye on the housekeepers, she didn't want to hear what I had to say and wanted to just fix the problem by getting my items. They weren't even they right items. I will NEVER stay here again. After everything this is BY FAR THE WORST HOLIDAY INN I HAVE EVER STAYED AT!!! That is saying at lot because I love staying at Holiday Inns. ;( :( ;(

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price, but with one big issue”
Reviews.Author: acdfpic
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel four times now and it is in a good location and I believe it's a good value. The rooms are large, clean, and nicely furnished. The staff is efficient, and pleasant enough. The parking is underground and secure, but if you have something larger than a compact car, getting into the parking spots may be a bit tricky. My major complaint is the noise from the floors above. The first time we stayed in the hotel, they gave us a top floor room, which was fine. The next three times we were on a middle floor. I can't believe that we got "foot stompers" above us each time, so it must be in the construction It is very noisy and was loud enough to wake me up, even with using ear plugs. This last time the person above us decided to go "walk about" at 3 am. The restaurant is just okay as mentioned in other reviews, but the staff was nice and I did have a very good plate of biscuits and gravy for breakfast. Overall the hotel is fine, but I'm afraid that I'll be looking for other lodgings for my next stay simply due to the noisy floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable parking and room rate”
Reviews.Author: trvlr7311
Reviews.Content: Good location on the north edge of downtown. Underground parking for $10 per night (cheap in Seattle). Next door is a restaurant where that they use for their breakfast and room service. Food is not bad, but breakfast menu is prices and limited. Nice rooms (recently upgraded), near downtown, Belltown, close to I-5, enter 99 North right behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced for average”
Reviews.Author: zedmonton
Reviews.Content: Okay, first off booking this hotel was a challenge and I finally had to call the hotel directly to change my information and they still messed it up so when I got there I spent 30 minutes trying to find out why they didn't have a room booked for me and it turned out to be their mess up. Next, you have to pay for parking and the stalls are all for compact cars only so thank God not too many people needed parking. The hotel corriders are dark, gloomy and maze like. Was not easy to find your way around. The rooms were okay, nicely decorated but the beds were lumpy and not comfortable. Not at all what I was expecting for a low season rate of $130.00 per night plus $10.00 per night for parking. The Marriotte was a comparable price for a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bwhfhb
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was in my price range. I spent two nights here by myself, as I was just taking a few days off before going further north. Upon arrival I needed to book an extra night (I also had to check in very late), which was no problem and cost me less than expected. Since I had never been to Seattle before, I also asked the staff for advice on several occasions. Every time I talked to them or needed something, the staff was very friendly and helpful, probably better than at any other hotel in this price range I have ever stayed at. The only problem I found was that there's a bit of air traffic noise, but it didn't bother me too much. The room wasn't the most modern room, but the friendly staff, good location (walking distance to everything you need) and cleanliness of the room made it very worth staying there, considering it's relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “SLEEPLESS in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Creekside
Reviews.Content: With an "fresh look" of this hotel chain and "newly renovated rooms", Holiday Inn Seattle did not WOW me at all with my first night of stay here. In fact it didn't even meet my basic needs. Here I am at 5:30am in the morning writing my review. Choppers are flying above the city (traffic report?) and big ventilation fans outside the building are up and running. Ok, I know, I'm in Seattle. But what didn't keep me asleep was the poor quality, horribly cheap beds. I just don't understand why hotels spend big money on granite counter tops and new carpet and latest TV sets, provide different types of pillows to choose from, but would not spend top dollars on updating the most important piece of furniture in their business, THE BEDS!!!!???? Have the hotel managers ever try to spend a few nights in their own hotels to find out how good the product really is? Or simply just send 2 managers up to the rooms, lie down IN THE SAME BED and turn aroud many times as you would if you were asleep. Did the bed move and shake? Did the bed give your back a full support? With my stay here, both of these essential conditions fail. Come on! You are in the business of providing a well rested night! Being successful is not just about a fully booked hotel. You are not anything near successful if your customer like me can not get any sleep because you have cheaped out on your beds!! I have stayed in a Motel 6 for 53 dollars a night in Everett and I woke up happy and smiling. What does that tell you? DON'T CHEAP OUT ON YOU BEDS!! That should be the FIRST item on your renovation list!! Other points noted on this trip: The noise from outside is definitely noticeble. The floors are not sound proof, it sounds like a hollow wooden structure. We could clearly hear people walking above us. No thermostat/temperature control in the room. There is an old style air condition unit under the window which we didn't use this time. (might be noisy when it's on) I gave 2 stars for the "renovation", but I would easily give no stars consider the quality of the beds. Will not return. I'd go back to Silver Cloud next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: tedbutlerutler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a four night stay. Nice central location a short walk from Seattle Center and downtown. Bus stop is right outside the hotel and can take you almost anywhere you want to go cheaply and easily. Room was very clean and well equipped and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to stay here again when in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PortlandMorgan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Seattle Center, which includes the Experience Music Project and the Space Needle. The rooms were very clean and appeared to have been recently renovated. The attached restaurant is only so-so but the staff, as well as the front desk staff, were all very friendly. In all I would recommend this hotel and will likely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jd4055
Reviews.Content: The manager at this hotel is not very accommodating to business travelers. Every business traveler knows that plans plans channge and the manager of this hotel charger me for a nights stay even through I had canceled the reservation before 6PM.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: akjCanada
Reviews.Content: I initially booked one night's stay due to the hotel's close distance to the start and finish of the Seattle Half Marathon. After I completed the run, I booked an additional night since it was so comfortable. The bed felt fantastic after running 13.1 miles and I appreciated the mini fridge and microwave. The room also had an iron and ironing board. The staff were very helpful and friendly, providing me with safety pins for my race bib when i requested them. Unfortunately, the coffee maker didn't work, which made the microwave especially handy. Parking is an additional fee but not exorbitant given the rates for parking around the hotel. Crews were renovating the lobby and the elevator areas of each floor during our stay, which made it a bit noisy, but crews stopped working at a reasonable time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: upgradeThis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the 'Denny triangle' just south of downtown so it is convenient for downtown, Capitol Hill and Seattle center areas. They have a restaurant on site which I didn't try on this visit, but I have on previous stays and it was very good. The rooms are always clean ,up to date and comfortable. I really like a fridge and micro and they have both in every room. The WiFi actually worked very well with good signal strength. The front desk staff is really friendly and helpful. Jaime , who checked me in is brilliant ! Basically for convenience and good quality mid priced hotel, this place is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Bunkbed room is different layout and cramped space”
Reviews.Author: onetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children age 11 and 9. Booked the bunk beds room and wished we didn't. Ours was a corner room split into two rooms to make the bunk bed area. It was a strange layout with the only closet in the bathroom which was off the bunk bed room. Bunk beds were in a second room which had the only desk. Our kids were too big for the bunk beds and the blankets kept coming off..made for much younger children. Our room had a queen bed that barely had any space to walk around with the tv armoire stuck in the corner . No table only a narrow sofa table against the wall so nowhere to put things except in the entry area over the fridge or the floor. No chairs in our queen room only the desk chair in the bunk bed room. Would have been nicer and much less cramped to just get a double queen room. If you have very small children and don't mind about small spaces to move in then this is fine. Overall staff was nice and hotel was clean, typical Holiday Inn. No view of space needle but only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the price”
Reviews.Author: Line J
Reviews.Content: Considering the price we where very positively suprised; the room was very nice and clean, especially the bathroom which is something I'm kind of obsessed with - it just have to be clean! The hotel was nice as well and it's located in a quiet neighborhood. It's a little bit far from downtown, however it's still within walking distance (approx. 10-15 min). We had no car while staying in Seattle, but if you like to walk around, it's no problem at all, but if we ever go back, we would probably prefer a hotel located downtown, but the Holiday Inn Seattle is still highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1960Cadillac
Reviews.Content: We came to stay here for a conference and everything was great. Parking is a bummer at $10 a day, but it is downtown Seattle, and its $4 an hour on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent inn near Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: Xiaoying C
Reviews.Content: Great location to visit Space Needle and EMP Museum. Service is excellent and free internet access. The room is really clean and the space is large enough. It is a little far away from the downtown but there are several buses going to downtown Seattle. And those buses take you to downtown shopping center like in 5 min.

Reviews.Title: “Near Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: ilajones
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Went with a tour group and they handled all 20 of use supurbly. Within walking distance of Seattle Center, and busy enough area to walk around after dark. The breakfast in the resturant is mediorce at best and very busy,I had to wait 20 minutes before being seated. Over all, just an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value of Money”
Reviews.Author: jai_dxb
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn. It is just a little walk into the heart of downtown(about 10 minutes), so it was a great way to start your day before grabbing your first cup of coffee. Super easy hotel to find, quick walk to the Light Rail, a few minute walk to downtown to all the restuarants

Reviews.Title: “‘20%’ saving - not”
Reviews.Author: tailes2
Reviews.Content: I had prepaid 3 weeks ago at a ‘20%’ saving but checking the web site the days before I would have been charged the same price. At check-in there was no acknowledge that I was a Gold club member, I asked if an upgrade was available and was told no but they did not charge the $10 per day parking. The hotel was not busy and they are renovating so the entrance was a mess and a number of workmen where around all the time. The room was nice enough and had been updated but the window faced another wing of the building about 25 feet away. Carpets in the halls were filthy and some wall papering was done but not for the whole floor, a bit here and a bit there. On the first night a child was running back and forth upstairs and it was VERY loud (not sure if the parents were there or not) called the front desk and about 10 minutes later it was a lot quieter. The second bight was better but still bouts of running. Not overly priced for close to downtown and within walking distance of most interesting spots. A few blocks (6) from the Space needle and about 20 minutes from Pike Place Market & 15 from the centre of the city. About 3 blocks from free bus service in the downtown area but only used it to go to the football game. I noticed that a few rooms had newspaper delivered to their door in the morning but not all. This place has to have the sloooooowest elevators (2). After waiting a few minutes I actually timed it and it was another 4.5 minutes for one to arrive. On another occasion someone said they waited 15 minutes for it to show. They have a limited room service menu, a 2 dollar delivery fee, an 18% gratuity change, plus leave space on the bill for a tip. Would I stay again, maybe, but would check out the HI Express right behind, at least you get breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: lizraabe
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn. It is just a little walk into the heart of downtown(about 10 minutes), so it was a great way to start your day before grabbing your first cup of coffee. Super easy hotel to find, quick walk to the Light Rail, a few minute walk to downtown to all the restuarants and things to do. Close walk to the Space Needle. The hotel was always very clean and they were doing matience, which they had signs all over for, but I never heard anything, and other than the signs never saw anything. Our room had a kitchenette outside the bathroom that was great for me to get ready there while someone else would be taking a shower. Our room always was clean and tidy when we would come back at the end of the day. I never felt like anything was out of place or missing. The bathroom and room were up to date and well maintained. The bed was adequate and had plenty of pillows. Lots of extra room to hang up clothes or put them away. The only downside was there was no breakfast, even to grab a quick piece of fruit before starting the day. The front desk was helpful and kind, it was usually the same guy in the mornings that made sure we knew where we were going or if we needed anything else or had other questions. The only issue was when we were leaving and asked to have a cab to take us to the Light Rail Station. There was a lady at the front desk, who just gave us a blank stare and didn't help us and acted as if we were her biggest problem of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...10 min walk to the Space Needle.”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaK2011
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel using Hotwire...great deal! It looks a bit older from the outside, but the inside is newly renovated and very clean. The desk staff was very friendly, and we were given a little bag with a bottle of water and microwave popcorn on arrival. Our room was new and had a fridge, microwave and flat screen tv. They also provided a few disposable plates/cutlery for the microwave...fantastic idea! We asked for a few extra towels as we had our two little girls with us...they were delivered to our room right away :) We walked to the Space Needle and it took about 10 minutes. The hotel is on the other side of Aurora Ave (very busy road!) I wish the hotel was on the same side as the Space Needle, but oh well! I've been to Seattle many times and have paid $200+ per night to stay at places like the Edgewater and the Monaco. I must say that this hotel is a FAR BETTER deal! We will definitely be back to the Holiday Inn on Dexter! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short term stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller035
Reviews.Content: A bit of a walk to Pike Street Markets. Not many restaurants within walking distance. If you have a car it is easy to get around. I'd recommend for couples or the busy traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was absolutely rude”
Reviews.Author: Anjafr
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days (2 rooms). Both rooms were not cleaned at all for 1 day, after complaining they apologized and offered fresh towels! When we arrived we couldnt park on the curb for check in because the manager told us big buses would be arriving and we had to make space for them, the entrance was being painted so we couldnt park there either so we had to find a spot down the street. On our last day although you have to pay for parking, it was full, after asking where we could park we were told rudely to find a spot on the street, but there was no spot on the street, so we asked if we could park in the check in zone and were told we would be ticketed if we did. After getting a bit upset the person in charge offered graciously to take the charge for the parking off our bill as a solution, but we still had no parking space, after back and forth he wrote us a note so we could use the parking space of a parking lot 2 blocks away.... This would all not have been a big issue if the staff would have been friendlier but they were short in responses and acting like nothing was their problem. Too bad the service was like this, the hotel is nice and the location great but I would never stay there again! The emerald grill whish is beside the hotel and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner is great! The staff there was the opposite of the hotel staff! Food was good and people superfriendly!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TheMikeBowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking through Priceline. The staff was very friendly when we checked in. When we got to our room, we realized it had two queen beds, so I called the front desk and asked if we could have a room with a king. Not only did they accommodate us, but they gave us a spacious corner room! Everything was very comfortable and relaxing. The construction was a bit of a downer, but they apologized in advance, and it will be even better when it's done. Also, the parking garage is a little wonky; the place to swipe your room key is on the left side of the entrance so it makes it rather difficult when you first go in. If they could move it to the middle, it would be much easier. However, it's a secure garage and pretty comparable to any other parking in the area at $10/night. Definitely worth the money, and we'd probably do it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “on the move”
Reviews.Author: leofiertl
Reviews.Content: good location rooms are good check in a bit of a problem but after that person went home the rest of staff very helpfull we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: ClivenMel
Reviews.Content: Attentive desk staff and we got a bigish room well appointed. Location is a short (maybe 15 mins) to city centre. Avoid Denny park unless you like mixing it with homeless beggars. Restaurant adjacent to hotel is handy and we thought prices were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: StillwaterFour
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 408 Sept. 14-18, then came back to stay in room 308 on Sept. 20. The first stay was great. The restaurant adjoining has great food, but is a little pricey. The room itself (408) was clean and the beds/pillows were amazingly comfortable. I wanted to take the bed & pillows home. When we stayed our final night in Seattle in room 308, the only issue we had was that the fridge was noisy and we were all woke up at 6am to the pounding of people on treadmills in the workout room which is close to that room. That was very annoying...if you plan on staying here, which I suggest, and like to sleep in, DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 308! Overall this hotel exceeded my expectations and I would recommend it to family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dinesh R
Reviews.Content: Location wise close to space needle and downtown.so if you dont mind a little walk you dont need a car. if you do, like we did, Parking is a very reasonable $10 a day (self parking). Very clean, rooms were nice, they did say they are doing some renovations but dint really come in the way. you do need to head out a little bit to get to some brunch places or even good coffee, but not too bad. Apparently the Holiday-Inn express just behind it has breakfast and a pool, so you could look into that if you are a big family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, good location if you don't mind some walking!”
Reviews.Author: knick76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August and really enjoyed it. It was clean and the staff were very polite. Our only complaint was it was a little bit further away from Downtown Seattle then we liked, other than that everything was perfect. It was about a 20 minute walk to Pike Place, 10 or so to the Space needle. Cab rides to the Pike Place Market were about 6 dollars if you don't like walking. But we saved close to 100 dollars a night vs other hotels, so if you want to save some money and still get a great hotel, definitely check it out. Also on our last day we stored our luggage after checking out, the staff unlocked the bathrooms for us so we could change which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient to Space Needle area”
Reviews.Author: luvtrvl525
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise the end of July 2011. The hotel was fine, not fancy but the price was decent for a clean, very good sized room close to things in Seattle. The TV is old style, the bed was just ok, but the room was good sized and the bathroom was nice and clean. They provided a coffee maker in the room but no complementary breakfast. There is a restaurant onsite that is ok. This hotel is close to the Space Needle and Ride the Ducks, Seattle Center too. You have to do a circle around the hotel to get to these places as there is a median blocking off the street behind the hotel. This is not a problem though, as going around there were restaurants, drugstores, etc. available. There were a couple shuttle buses available for people to ride to the piers to get on their cruise ships. Did not need an advance ticket. We would certainly stay here again if we wanted to be close to the Space Needle area.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: brentom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights as we were holidaying in Seattle. Front desk staff were awesome they let us check in early and provided accurate directions and helpful tips. We were disappointed that this Holiday Inn had no complimentary breakfast. There was a restaurant right beside it, but of course this was not free! The room was large, clean, somewhat dated and they are undergoing some renovation, so this will help. We felt very safe in this location, as we walked to many locations from here. The underground parking was safe and secure for our vehicle. As you can expect you will pay to stay close to all the attractions in the middle of summer and we did - glad I got some priority rewards points out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: hitechwoman
Reviews.Content: A little run down however they seem to be renovating. Walking distance to a lot of Seattle attractions. Good place if you just need to sleep after all the sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TraveledtheWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two different nights before and after a cruise. Room was large, cheerful, and clean. Had advised of early arrival for return visit and were accommodated by getting a room before noon. Really appreciated the attention and help with transportation to cruise terminal. Staff were helpful, friendly, and efficient. Would recommend this hotel for a good place to say at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicer HI properties”
Reviews.Author: Heywoodya
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my wife on a business trip for this stay. I had some accounts in downtown Seattle that were within walking distance (long walk), so I managed to get some business done also. The hotel is going through room renovations, so not everything is done yet. We stayed on the sixth floor east side...which is the only side to stay on if you want any kind of a view. Otherwise, you're looking at another building. The eastside, however, faces a fairly busy street, so noise is a bit of a problem. The higher you go, the less a factor this is. Our room had not been renovated yet, but it was, never the less, large, clean, and comfortable. I rated this stay as Average, but I would say slightly higher...but not all the way to Very Good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Abogail
Reviews.Content: Booked Executive Room TV did not work,no remote,Safe not working movies for the coffee room not as good as some basic rooms that I have stayed in. Booked in for 10nights and moved after one night nag going elsewhere my wife is withe and concurs with this view

Reviews.Title: “Disappointedn”
Reviews.Author: Higgisx4
Reviews.Content: We booked this for 4 nights while travelling in Seattle & British Columbia. We are a family of 4 & wanted somewhere we could make a sandwich & have breakfast so chose this with a kitchenette.There was a fridge & microwave & 4 plastic plates & no cutlery. It was very noisy from road traffic but on our last night a coach stopped outside our room around 4 am. It woke us with it's reversing hooters & kept it's engine running. After 30 minutes I contacted reception who told me they were sorting out. It did turn it's engine off after about another 20 mins but the noise from it continued ( ? The air con) until after we got up.

Reviews.Title: “A la carte mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: jim_julian
Reviews.Content: Made a two night stop here on Priority Club points. Staff acknowledged PC Platinum status on arrival, no upgrade. Perks consisted of morning newspaper and 10% discount coupon for in-house restaurant. Room was spartan hard core industrial. Ten dollar charge per day for parking ... never saw that during the booking process, but maybe I missed it. No free breakfast. On my last morning got an unsolicited 8AM wake up call (tactic to get guests to leave?) Every morning was awakened at 6:30AM by garbage trucks emptying dumpsters in the alley. WiFi was very slow; hard wire Ethernet had good performance. On the positive side the front desk staff was young, energetic and helpful. Would not repeat ... stay at the Holiday Inn Express next door, at least you'll get breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Morguenna
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Suite which was quite large. Clean and the bed was comfortable. Didn't use the TV or amenities. Parking was $10 and I could walk to the conference I was attending.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for short stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: susiewinks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights prior to Alaska Cruise and we were very happy will all aspects of the hotel. The room was of a good size and clean. No view, but this didn't bother us as we weren't in the room for any great length of time during the day. It was quiet during the night, we heard the traffic about 0700hrs, but it didn't really disturb us. Great advice at reception on the location of local transport, and also where to have a good breakfast other than at the hotel restaurant - local place 5 min walk away call Hurricanes - recommended for a hearty breakfast! Really enjoyed Seattle and would have loved to have stayed for longer. Would be happy to return to this hotel for another stay as it's location is great for getting out and about in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Much Nicer Places For the Same Money”
Reviews.Author: dgalvan1986
Reviews.Content: Dated cheap decor. Broken gym equipment. And the a/c doesn't seem to work in the common areas. It's definitely not worth more than $80/night, not even for the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Your good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMySuitcase_11
Reviews.Content: Service was very nice, rooms clean and spacy. Hotel breakfast (& other meals) at nearby restaurant but isn't for free as might be implied...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, most have views of walls.”
Reviews.Author: SeaWaGal
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here.. typical hotel amenities. Staff was very rude with a couple major exceptions. Not many rooms have views, but the rooms I stayed in were spacious and clean. Restaurant adjoining was reasonable and tasty. LIttle Red Bistro a few blocks down the street was a cool place for coffee or lunch. Bed was fairly good, nice bedding. Loved how large the room was. Large TV and space to work or relax in the room. Denny Park nearby has pretty trees.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, standard rooms, reasonable price, thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Guitarra31
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and close to the most of the major landmarks. Easy to find, althouth some Seattle streets can be confusing (think one way streets). The staff was extremely friendly and attentive: Called cabs for us asap, recommended restaurants, sent towels asap. Everything was good about this hotel except the noise from the hallway...especially at 3am. You could basically hear their whole conversation, word for word. Its a small annoyance as once they enter their rooms the noise goes down tremendously. Unless they decided to have a conversation in the hallway for 10 minutes. =( But I'm sure if we had informed the staff they would have taken care of the situation. It was over before we knew it and back to sleep ZzzZzz. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LtColRiley
Reviews.Content: We selected the Holiday Inn Seattle (City Center) on the heels of a Royal Caribbean cruise based on its proximity to the Space Needle. The staff was quite pleasant, and the rooms were clean and neat. It's co-located with the Holiday Inn Express which actually might better serve a family based on the Express offering free breakfast and a swimming pool, but the Express was also $40 more per night, so it was a coin toss for us. The hotel was conveniently located near the space needle and monorail, and there were plenty of local restaurant options within a 10 minute walk, so we give this hotel two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, in center of seattle”
Reviews.Author: SimonHThomas
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Seattle, the hotel was clean and comfortable. The desk staff were very helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions. The adjoining restaurant was excellent for both dinner and breakfast. If you happen to only be staying in Seattle a short time and don't want to venture far I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: buffie46
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was very nice, 2 queen size beds in good size room. Reception staff very helpful & polite. Very easy walk to restaurants & supermarkets. We even walked to Pike Markets. We booked a transfer to the Seattle Port (through the hotel at $8pp) as we were doing an Alaskan cruise after we checked out. We booked for 10.30am pick up & waited outside for minibus to take us, when it arrived the driver proceded to pile us (4people) plus another 6 people into the 8 seater plus all our luggage in the back which he pushed & shoved until he got the doors shut & then drove as if he was driving a Formula 1 racing car to the port, very frightening. One man even had to sit on his wife's lap, very unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: cherbear817
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this particular hotel, everything was just what I expected, very clean, the staff was very professional and pleasant to deal with. The restaurant next door was excellent, great food, good service even though they were remodeling it. It was a pleasant surprise. The room was very clean, very quite and the bed was comfortable too. No bad smells either. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but very dated”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here - location is not so bad - close to the Space Needle and about 15-20 minutes walk from Downtown / Market Place. Rooms looks very dated indeed as does the whole hotel. Service relatively good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Hot water problems.”
Reviews.Author: hppytrlz
Reviews.Content: Location is very very good. Traffic noise not too too bad. No hot water 2 mornings out of 3. Kept saying boiler was not working. They did compensate with $ off our bill. However... their "blackout curtains" are nothing of the sort. They are way too short. At 6:30 am the room lights up like the Vegas Strip. But the hotel is one of the nicer looking Holiday Inns. Location is reallly nice. Hope they can fix the details like the curtains and hot water issues.

Reviews.Title: “a goo deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: MichelleM3065
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed here in late March of 2011; we were visiting her daughter who was stationed at the Everett Navel Base. It was a good hotel at a good price. It is just outside of the downtown area, about 5 blocks from the Space Needle. It is clean and there are quite a few amenities close by. Two words of warning: if you are using a debit card instead of a credit card, they will debit the whole amount of your room on the day that you check in. This wasn't a problem but I wasn't aware of it. The second thing, the shower head needs to be adjusted(sp?) or you will end up a little bit sore. There is no free breakfast but the Shell gas station mini mart has snacks and food (which we didn't try) and Walgreen is about 4 blocks away from the hotel. We didn't rent a car but the hotel is right next to the highway for anyone who wants to have a car. Public transportation in Seatlle is great and cheap but you need to take a bit of time to figure it out. The buses are free in Downtown from 6 am until 7 pm. We are planning another trip to Seattle this summer and we are very eager to see this city again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your family memory at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pattipooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with sister, 2 teens and one tween. They said it was OK to have 5 people, as lots of people did, but could not provide a cot as it was against fire regulations to have 5 people! Parking is horrendous; every parking spot in the lot was marked "COMPACT" and could hardly park our van. Nails sticking out everywhere from very low garage ceiling and felt very unsafe. Water in shower luke warm, no water pressure, outdated decor, had a "view room" which looked at another bldg. Restaurant is absolutely horrible with terrible quality food but all the staff was nice and I felt sorry for them having to work at a place where they probably had to apologize for everything! Not well maintained. I had read many mixed reviews about this place but please, do not waste your money. Spend abit more and stay at Hyatt Place or anywhere if you aren't booking last minute!

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasonmeares
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay! The staff was very friendly, accomodating and professional. The room was clean, the beds comfy and they promptly brought up a crib for our toddler to sleep in, no charge! We will stay here again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: vancouverVioletBc
Reviews.Content: I was able to purchase a 2 queen bedroom for $75 for two nights and it was better than expected! The lobby of the hotel was very nice and although the hallways to your room is outdated it is very clean! The standard room had a mini fridge/microwave and sink too. Plus the bathroom was very nice with granite counter tops. The location of the hotel is a 5 minute drive away towards Pike Place and very close to the needle, pacific science museum, EMP, zoo etc. Parking charge is $10 a night and be expected to pay parking for everywhere you go in seattle. On our first night (saturday), we called the concierge at midnight to ask what to do in seattle and he was really great to suggest us a few places and get us addresses too! We also got free high speed internet access which never failed and hot water was never a problem for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: bjrb_2009
Reviews.Content: Wow- this hotel and the staff really set a high standard in every possible way. We travelled there with 45 kids!!!! and they accommodated all our craziness with a smile on their face every time. The meals prepared were fresh, healthy and delicious - I've never eaten so much!!! The Hotel is very safe and secure and we were treated with respect and priority. Would have NO hesitation in recommending this hotel and would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Try it and you will enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Andreassn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Seattle for 2 nights in november. The hotel gives you nothing but satisfaction. From the moment you walk through the doors until you check out you are treated very good. The rooms are large although the bathrooms are a little small. The location of the hotel is good. Only a few blocks from Seattle Center and the space needle. The staff at the front desk are great especially Mike and Jamie. The made our stay special. Do try the Emerald Grill Restaurant next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Expat_American
Reviews.Content: Got a Priceline bid of $60+ per night versus rack rate of $109+ per night (excluding weekends). Either way you go, this is a gret hotel to stay at. Front desk staff very friendly and willing to help in any way possible. Maintiance guy is also the delivery guy for blankets and whatever at night. Housekeeping is very meticulos in their cleaning. Free newspapers in lobby every day, small business center (no heat in winter in that room). Coke and Pepsi vending on alternating floors. Very close to Seattle Center and Space Needle. Bus stops not that far away from hotel. Parking $10/night in 4 floor underground garage with elevator access. Key card entry to garage. Technical aspect: Very modern, Free in room WIFI. Small drawback of no heat lamp in bathroom and a small always running exhaust fan in the bathroo. Upside, plenty of hot water in shower/bath and plenty of water pressure. Small kitchenette by the door with sink, microwave, coffe maker, refridgerator. Under the sink is a cabinet. Also included are 3 plastic throwaway plates and airline style silverware packs. Luggage stool behind the door for your big heavy suitcase and plenty of space in the room for the rest. Beds are double queen or single king with semi firm mattreses. Wired WIFI in room that is login/password controled. Other furnishings are a padded chair and a computer desk and chair. TV (old CRT model) has games via the Lodge Net tv system. TV system was acting up at the time we were there, missing audio on 1 channel and missing video on other channels. Staff was made aware, but it is beyond their ability to correct that problem. There is the standard wall forced air heater/air conditioning unit in the room. that is very quiet. Staff: Very friendly and polite. Front desk will do their best to recomend local resturants and other points of interest if your from out of town and ask. They are a small staff and if you have a noisy neighbor all they can do is call that room and tell them to calm down. The night manager may get involved if it is beyond what a phone call can do. They blocked the room above me that was giving me the noise trouble for the next night and we got a good sleep that night. Maintance guy was working on keep the sidewalk in front of the hotel snow free as well as the drive through area during the big artic storm that came through town while we were there. When checking out I had enough weight to flatten the wheels on the bellman's cart, so I mentioned this to the desk and they called the on duty maintaince guy and he came out and asked what was wrong and I pointed it out to him. When I put the cart back inside he grabbed it shortly after that and took it to the shop to pump up the tires. Extra comments: King5 TV is next door so you might hear some helicopter noise now and then, but it is very minmal. The queen room we got was next to the alley and the garbage trucks come around 7am every day or other day to empty the trash bins, they are pretty quiet. The attached resturant has a limited menu, but breakfast is always good there. Wait staff are very friendly. Hotel is within walking distance of a couple of drug and convience stores. A pizza resturant (Zeeks Pizza, a good place to eat) is 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The Huricane resturant is within 5 minutes walking distance, try the chili there. We are considering staying there again at full price if we need a short term place to stay during out vacations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: LJV1515
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Nice, clean, spacious room. Kitchenette, fridge, microwave. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Quiet. Friendly staff. Restaurant next door at Holiday Inn Express was very good. We used taxis to get around as there were 4 of us to split cost and my friends were not walkers. To walk to Pike Place Market would probably take about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: wannamovethere
Reviews.Content: The service at this Holiday Inn was great. We would certainly stay there again if in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is suitable. We stayed on the executive floor during our stay. There was free wifi which was a nice bonus. There are no views from any of the rooms. For a view of the space needle you will need to check into the holiday inn express next door. The parking garage is the tightest parking garage I have even been in. When I was entering. another car was exiting and thee had to backup a full level before we could pass each other. On the bright side, it only cost $10. The room was spacious and included a kitchenette with a microwave and sink. The executive lounge had 2 computers with internet access, free breakfast and evening drinks. If travelling back to Seattle to visit the space needle I would likely stay at the Holiday Inn Express to give it a try. Also, the neighborhood around this hotel is shady at best, but it allows for quick and easy access into and out of seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel is dated”
Reviews.Author: txgrizzly
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is right next door to a Holiday Inn Express. If we had it to do over again, we would stay at the Holiday Inn Express. The Holiday Inn wasn't bad, but it is rather dated and in need of an update. When we walked into the lobby, I had flashbacks of the early 80's. Everything was clean, though. We arrived about three hours prior to the stated check-in time; but they went ahead and put us in a room, which we greatly appreciated. The only problem we had during our stay was our toilet did not work quite right. For this inconvenience, they waived the parking fee. On a positive note, the location is great! Seattle Center, with the Space Needle and other attractions, is only a few blocks away. We even walked to Pike Place Market, although that is some distance away. All in all, it wasn't a bad experience; but we would probably choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Denali_Dreams
Reviews.Content: First, you need to know that the Holiday Inn Express is right next to the Holiday Inn hotel. Different check-in and parking areas. When we arrived after a long day of flying to the Emerald City, we were greeted by friendly and thoroughly professional staff. I am a Priority Club member, a a fact that was not lost on the staff (it said so on my reservation). The Lobby was light and spacious and our room was very clean and modern/up-to-date with the amenities of a refrigerator, microwave and sink. Our room overlooked Dexter Avenue and although a rather busy street, it was quiet and we slept well. Being somewhat jet-lagged, we opted for the restaurant at the hotel our first night. A thoroughly pleasant surprise. The food was good, and the staff friendly and attentive. This also turned out to be just as true in the morning breakfast as well. We ordered room service after our first night here. Room service was equally timely, friendly, and the food was quite good. Located just across from the Seattle Center, it was well located for our daily excursions around town for the various sights we wanted to see. A morning walk to Queen Anne Hill got the morning started with views of the city, the Space Needle, and the Mountain (when it's out). About the parking in the underground garage...not for the timid. The compact car spaces are designed for just that...compact cars. I assume the spaces on the lower level are larger, but I never had a problem finding a space on the upper level (I was driving a compact rental car). But if you are driving a "land-yacht," like the 1970's Cadillac Fleetwood I saw shoe-horned into a "compact car" space on the upper level, you are going to find parking a challenge. Trust me. It will be easier to have other riders wait for you in the lobby, which is easy to reach once you leave the garage. We had three very pleasant nights here and wanted to stay here again on our last night in Seattle a week later, but they were already booked for the weekend. We would definitely return here again based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britromancer
Reviews.Content: We found this Holiday Inn to be a reasonable place to stay if on a budget and if you plan to spend minimal time in the room. It is not too far from the attractions and provides a comfortable clean bed (although the floor could have been a little cleaner) Having said that, it was basic and adequate and not luxurious. We discovered that there were better choices if you are willing to shell out another 40 or so dollars per night. We'd recommend staying here if saving money is a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: pqeoiru
Reviews.Content: So many smiles on so many faces. The people that work here put this hotel head and shoulders above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Ciyra
Reviews.Content: Good solid hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. Shower was good and room had a mini fridge which is one of my top things I want in the room. We got two rooms and both were the same. Not a fabulous view from either room, in fact we were looking at a brick wall, but since we priceline'd the rooms for $75 a night, this was to be expected. It was a bit of a walk to the Space Needle, about 5 blocks, but nothing extreme. All the girls went to dinner at SkyCity, the dads stayed home with the kids, and we made the walk back to the hotel at 11:30 on a Saturday night. It's not a scary area at all and we felt very comfy walking by ourselves. They're pretty helpful at the front desk. When we couldn't get a bottle of wine open with the flimsy hotel corkscrew, they sent me and my wine over to the lounge where the bartender happily opened it for me with a real corkscrew and sent me on my way back up to the room. My only complaint is that they don't appear to have any bell service at all. We had to haul all our bags to the room ourselves. Parking was affordable ($10 a night) but the spaces were so close that we worried we couldn't get into the car. Overall, this is a good quality hotel. Nothing special, but perfectly acceptable. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but....”
Reviews.Author: pdxballard
Reviews.Content: I've stayyed at Holiday Inn 3 times in the past 30 days and although there are some consistency this one was a bit off. The room that we opted for was a queen with a separate room with bunkbeds for the kids (teenagers). The room was extremely tight although the kids room was nice enough. The bathroom was in their room so that was a small inconvience. I would definately not recommend the second floor facing Dexter Avenue - very noisy even though we specifically asked the front desk clerk if the room was quiet. typically they give you a water or something to say thanks for being a priority club member but instead we received a % off a bottle of wine. There was no free breakfast either which again after staying in 2 other Holiday Inns in two other states it seemed like I was cheated. I'm not crazy about the Express breakfast but it is something and one of the reasons why I booked Holiday Inn. The location is close to several key things, downtown, space needle, Pikes Market but the immediate surroundings are industrial. Overall not a do over for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcharris1
Reviews.Content: Just had a five day stay here and I must say it exceded my expectations the room smelled very fresh and looked clean when we entered, The room and bathroom was very clean all 5 days our room was cleaned impecably.The room had a microwave and refrigerator witch was convinient, our towels were changed daily, our bed was done daily, and our ammenites (shampoo and lotion) aswell. The bed was very comfortable the sheets were amazing. The hotel staff was very friendly and even showed us places we could visit while in seattle, The only downside to the hotel in a $10 doller charge for parking, however there is a security guard at night in the parking basement witch made me confortable leaving the car their. Overall my experince was GREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room was entered!”
Reviews.Author: highm
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel and decided that it would be the place for my stay in Seattle. I was a single woman, booked for two nights. Check in went easily and the staff was friendly. I reserved a non-smoking room. Upon entry to my room, I noticed that it was a smoking room, complete with ashtray, but it was late, so I just let it go. They next evening, I returned to my room, and noticed that the room had not been cleaned, no made bed,no clean linens, but I didn't want to complain, so I let it go. At 10:30pm, I heard the doorknob being jingled, and thought it was a confused guest, so I silently stood at the door, waiting on them to move on when they couldn't enter. However, they just kept trying and ultimately, the deadbolt opened, and thank goodness for the safety latch at the top of the door, it caught it and I slammed the door shut, and locked it again. I immediately called the front desk and told them that someone opened my deadbolted door, and the man replied that it was an employee that thought the room was "unoccupied." At 10:30pm, they should have called the room, or knocked, or what was the concern about the room being occupied or not since it wasn't sold out! So, I barricaded the door with my luggage, and stayed awake all evening, wondering if they would try to reenter. Next morning, I made a complaint to the manager, which was not the same as the evening before, and he was concerned that an employee would enter my room, unannounced, at 10:30pm. He said that he would follow up, and seemed to take my issue seriously, as the situation was to me. So, a wonderful hotel, with excellent service, and accommodations, but my experience was everything but. You decide what you want to do. I know that I won't attempt this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Get What you Pay For”
Reviews.Author: jainsterk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were in town for the Seattle Marathon. It was close to the start line which was a huge bonus. This hotel was a typical Holiday Inn, average. However, it was comfortable and clean. The front desk staff was fantastic, they were helpful and really nice and friendly. We had them arrange a ride to the airport for us, the guy that drove us, in his own SUV, was awesome. Really kind and good conversation. The hotel was walking distance to most Seattle attractions. The neighborhood was kind of dodgy but not scary dodgy, just industrial. We didn't use room service, we ate breakfast down the road at Whole Foods, it was good, pricey but good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Illawarra
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in a hotel close to the Space Needle and relatively close to the city. This hotel exceeded expectations, even the parking was priced reasonably. My room was huge, very clean and had free internet. The staff answered many questions, check in and out was effortless. I was sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accountable staff”
Reviews.Author: Bestbeancounter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family for 2 nights when we landed in Seattle. The hotel lobby was nice, the staff that dealt with us were very friendly and helpful as well. The room was clean when we walked in, everything was good. When we asked questions in regards to renting vehicles and getting around Seattle teh staff were very helpful. On our last night we were woken up at 2:30am because there was a party going on right above us and it sounded like they were dragging furniture and picking them up and dropping them on the floor. We called Front Desk and the guests in that room was taken care of within 30 minutes (We later find out in the morning they were escorted out). Waking up that same morning we saw an envelope under our door and it was an apology from the staff about last night's debacle so they gave us a $20 voucher breakfast at the Emerald Grill which we thought was a nice gesture. They had the cab ready for us ahead of time as we had to leave for the Amtrak station at 6:45am. So all in all it was a good experience minus the debacle from other guests. It was relatively close to the Space Needle, and rental car companies were within 5 blocks away, so it was pretty easy to get around for us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Value, Location was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights; I was given a quiet room upon my request at check-in and was pleased with the room. It had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and a sink. The gym had some outdated cardio machines, so I didn't use this gym and intead used the 24 Hr Fitness about a mile away. The room was clean. The business center has 2 computers for free use (with very slow internet service). The hotel iteself is near the Space Needle and Seattle Center (a 10 min walk, max)- if you are planning to spend alot of time there, then this is a good location. It is also not that far from South Lake Union (a 15-20 min walk). I didn't spend a lot of time at either of these places, so I usually walked to Pike's Market/Downtown, which was about a mile walk- it wasn't raining, so I enjoyed the walk, but if it had been, I would have been spending more time on the bus. The hotel is not in the " free ride area" that the buses have during the day, so if you do plan to use the bus, then it is about a 3+ block walk to the closest stop at 6th Avenue or Battery (I am guessing on this, as I never used this)There is a nearby bus stop for other buses within a minute walk by the hotel, like the bus to Fremont. While I would recommend this hotel to a friend, I am not sure I would personally go back to this particular hotel, only due to the location in relation to my points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing the downtown sites”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleAZ57
Reviews.Content: We booked thru a discounter and were pleased with the location, convenience and hositality of the staff. Small pub syle restaurant attached with room service available saved looking for something within walking distance. Convenient to Pike's Place Market and Space Needle. (Plan to spend an extra $10 per night to park in the hotel's garage)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: bjrb_2009
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful stay at the Holiday Inn. They were very accommodating and looked after us well. We were going to a Seahawks game and they hooked us up with transport straight away - rather than us getting ripped of by a taxi! The room was clean and well appointed. I read some other reviews that complained about road and siren noise - THEN DONT STAY IN A CITY - stay on a freakin farm.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but Clean”
Reviews.Author: NewTravelAdventures
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Room was clean but typical. Nothing extra. No breakfast included. There is a restuarant on site, food rather bland. We could hear a lot of traffic noise all the time. Also people walking above you. $10 a night parking was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loving Seattle, 2 years in a row”
Reviews.Author: Groupeventplanner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came back to Seattle for the second year in a row following a wonderful visit last year. During last year's stay, we lodged at the Holiday Inn Express that sits next to Holiday Inn, so we are very familiar with the area. This year, the area felt different. I don't know if it was because I am comfortable with the area, but it didn't feel sketchy like it did last year. There were plenty of professionals and vacationers walking around. I felt completely safe. Mostly, we crossed Denny Way, passed the awesome Pink Elephant car wash, and walked down Bell to get to the Market and everything else. The room was very clean and comfortable. The front desk was super friendly and helpful holding our bags so we could go downtown while we waited for our room to become available. The cab fare seemed more expensive this year from the airport, so we may consider alternative transportation next time getting to the hotel. If you are looking for breakfast options, I recommend Top Pot Donuts, located on 5th street. Fresh donuts, good coffee, in a great cafe environment. We went almost every morning of the 4 days we spent in the city. I highly recommend the HI. It's 1 mile from Pike Place Market, 2 from the baseball and football stadiums. The walking will help you work off the donuts!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete-and-Liz
Reviews.Content: Booked the King Bunk Bed kids suite for a 3 night visit to Seattle. Room was very good. Clean and to the standard you would have expected of a big hotel chain This separates the kids in to a room of their own, with TV etc, but within the main room. It’s a good idea, giving both parties a little bit of freedom and privacy. The only problem we had was the TV in the kids room didn’t work properly and when it did, it only showed adult programmes. After a couple of calls to maintenance and the front desk over the next 24 hrs the TV was replaced and the content restrictions for the kids TV was removed. Ironically the restriction removed the only channels the kids watched, Disney and the Cartoons. A good bonus was, depending on your deal, the fact that kids eat free for breakfast and the evening meal should you choose to dine in the hotel restaurant. We did two nights and the food was not bad although the choice was a little limited. The Hotel is in a good location, 5 mins walk from the Space needle, Sci-Fi museum and the Music museum. We even walked to Pike place market in 25 min. I would stay there again as its good value and a good location with secure parking ($10 which is very good for Seattle). Yes and the lifts/elevators are very slow which was the source of some amusement to us but frustrating to other we met.

Reviews.Title: “needs new elevators...SLOOOOOOOOOOOOW!”
Reviews.Author: graminizer
Reviews.Content: very clean and tidy hotel. Friendly and helpfull staff, but the elevators are extremely slow. Every time we needed the elevator, there were lineups. Stair access is limited. The restaurant has weird hours(Closes after lunch and opens again for dinner) and the food was cold when we ordered breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeterGC
Reviews.Content: Most comfortable bed I've found, KIng size with choice of pillows. Very helpful staff. Restaurant closes in afternoon. Short walk to Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair1976
Reviews.Content: Good quality stay as you'd expect from a holiday inn. No problems and good service

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant 2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Livilian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights en route to Vancouver in June 2009. Caught airporter bus from airport. Fairly expensive but they had us at the hotel in approximately half an hour. Check in process was easy. Rooms tidy and clean. Restaurant/bar next door - food good and service excellent. Whist the location is in downtown dont think this is exactly in the city centre. You have a half hour walk or so to be in the centre of town. Free internet access in your room was useful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, with a few cautions”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: This review was heading for 2-star country but was redeemed by the manager's concern. Call it a 3.5. First, the positives - Our room was typical Holiday Inn, perfectly adequate for the purpose. The location is convenient to attractions, and walking a few blocks you can be inside the Ride Free Area for public transportation. The neighborhood is not elegant, but we didn't feel it was sketchy as another reviewer did. Internet service was good; we don't have wifi on the laptop,so being able to still plug into a data port was very helpful. Staff was helpful but not totally knowledgeable, we had a heck of a time figuring out how to get the bus downtown, Parking is convenient, though it's really a tight squeeze getting in and out. Now the problem - Our room was really noisy. The exhaust vent in the bathroom was audible in the bedroom. More troublesome, there was a more or less constant machinery noise behind the wall near the window, perhaps the a/c or plumbing system. Normally, I'd just ask to be moved. In this case I didn't because we had very limited time to tour the city. When we checked out I mentioned this to the manager behind the desk, who apologized, scolded me gently for not complaining sooner, and knocked off our parking fees. So, I'd recommend it, but listen carefully before you unpack..

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions & very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Bucca5033
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to the Space Needle and down to the water. It is a little hike to get to the Market but you can walk (we did) Public transportation is very convienent as well. I did not feel unsafe walking around there, even at night. The front desk people are very nice & helpful. I was treated so nice and was surprised when I checked in that I was put on the executive level. The executive lounge was a very nice touch as well. The price was very attractive and well worth it to experience Seattle! I will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: happymcmartin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place! Location is awesome, right there by the space needle and downtown Seattle. Rooms are very nice and also very clean. The hotel has a lot of amenities. No pool at this location. Staff is SO NICE AND SO HELPFUL!!! STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and customer care”
Reviews.Author: PRAMODSISODIA
Reviews.Content: It was very good experience, we stayed there for a week and staff there had been very helpful and curteous. Services were excellant and cleanliness was superb. Since this was our first visit to USA, hotel staff was good in supporting us by helping in getting transport, other facilities and guiding how to go about. One of the front desk manager helped in getting our hotel booked for New York and promptly gave all documents while we were away for conference.. Keep it up!! Pramod Sisodia

Reviews.Title: “Better off Next Door”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: Booked the Holiday Inn in advance for just the night before coming home fromm Seattle. Booked a kids suite on the executive floor as it provides access to the club lounge and you get breakfast. Arrival was good and efficient and they recognised the platium card but did not offer or provide any benefits. Room was freezing and very cramped thought eh kids loved the bunk beds. There was a microwave sink and coffee maker but no almosr no wardrobe space. The bathroom was simply awful. Cramped cold and the vent open to the elements incluiding all the street noise. We had arrived late and did not explore. The following day we had breakfast in the lounge and were the only guests. It was terrible on almost every level. Choice was poor quality worse and absolutely no service. We were due to leave for London at 7pm and so requested a late check out. 3pm was all we wanted and given the platinum status thought it would be simple. Not a bit of it. They have no staff post 12.30 and so no late checkout was allowed. As a result we packed up and left our stuff in the ar while we had a look around Seattle. Given our experience in Bellingham 10 days earlier we should have stayed at the HI express next door. I will next time. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Seattle Dexter Ave BEST”
Reviews.Author: jaskowskid
Reviews.Content: ***** 5 star clean ever corner is clean. ALL employee of the Holiday Inn Seattle 211Dexter Ave. North, Seattle, Wa 98109 . Was very helpful and friendly. The room was peacefull and comfortable. The restaurant next door was clean. and the food good. The bus service in Seattle was quick and easy to use. The desk courts help us fined the wright bus to catch. We want to a boat show at Qwest Center to China town for dinner back to the Holiday Inn on the Seattle bus system. Get off and on when we want. The Holiday in location was great for coming and going. [-]

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wearytraveller_9
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel and close to many famous Seattle attractions. Upon our check-in, we were greeted by very nice and knowledgeable staff who gave us tour maps of the area and coupons to use in the restaurant/lounge attached to the hotel. Only had breakfast, but it was excellent with good friendly staff. Room very nice andclean, comfortable bed. Nice updated furnishings and remodeled rooms. Free internet.Walked to the Space Needle within a few minutes. The only downside to the hotel was the $10 parking fee per night, but most of the parking in downtown Seattle is pretty expensive anyway. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning on doing touristy things in Seattle and who doesn't want to pay for an expensive downtown Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: invisible999
Reviews.Content: I have to admit - I stay with Holiday Inn/Express because they are appx 20% cheaper that same class Hilton/Marriott hotels (Garden Inn, etc) and because they offer double miles. Taken away those incentives and I'd always stay at Hilton/Marriott. This particular hotel in Seattle is nothing extraordinary - you get what you've paid for. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly, parking is $10 (show me the same class hotel with free secured parking - I'll stay there next time). I'd recommend stay here if you are for a business meeting(s) and those are primarily in downtown. However if you need to travel other side of the lake than probably it would be better to find something there. Traffic on ALL roads is a disaster. Avoid I-405 at ALL costs. It took me 45 minutes to travel 12 miles - you've got an idea.

Reviews.Title: “neighborhood not so great, rooms are convenient”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Seattle. Neighborhood absolutely ok during the day, at night not so great to go out for a woman. Rooms are well equipped and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Seattle”
Reviews.Author: denali1118
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Seattle. We found this hotel to be very accommodating and close to many famous Seattle attractions. Upon our check-in, we were greeted by a very nice and knowledgeable staff who gave us tour maps of the area and coupons to use in the restaurant/lounge attached to the hotel (we only had drinks, so I cannot make any recommendations about the food). We went up to our room and found it to be very nice with a clean, comfortable bed. It seems that Holiday Inns have done some re-branding recently, and with that has come updated furnishings and remodeled rooms. We quickly went exploring around the hotel and walked to the Space Needle within 15 minutes (there is a busy street behind the hotel with no way to get across, so you must walk a little out of the way to get to a cross walk). Additionally, we had tickets to a University of Washington football game and the campus was a quick drive from the hotel. We had a short drive to Pike's Market, but we determined that it would have been a pleasant walk to and from the Market if we had not planned on shopping. The only downside to the hotel was the $10 parking fee per night, but most of the parking in downtown Seattle is pretty expensive anyway. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning on doing touristy things in Seattle and who doesn't want to pay for an expensive downtown Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: laurierene
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel last week to attend a concert at the Key Arena. The staff was SUPER friendly (loved the Executive Housekeeper that let me bum a smoke). The rooms were clean and the arena was within walking distance. I will stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: whatohok
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent room, in a good location this is the place to stay. The hotel is within walking distance to Key Arena, the Space Needle, and the monorail which will take you downtown. Room was clean, nice bedding on a comfortable bed. The only minor complaint is the carpet looked a little dingy, but I guess that is to be expected due to high use/ traffic. Another bonus is there is a parking garage at the hotel. For $10 you can leave your car all day while you go see the sites. I would stay here again, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Okay location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: LouiseAl
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Seattle is a nice place to stay. It is located close to the Spaceneedle and the Monorail and while the area lacked restaurants, we were in comfortable walking distance to the city center. We had no problems walking in the area at night. Our rooms were clean and spacious and the front desk staff extremely friendly and helpful. There was a do-it-yourself laundry service which came in very handy for us plus a convenient soda-machine on one of the floors and a little 'office' where you could use a computer, internet and printer for free. Good, clean and basic. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at The Holiday Inn again, but given the choice I would probably pick a hotel closer to the city center. It wasn't that we paid very big bucks to stay at The Holiday Inn, but I feel that we could have gotten an equally nice hotel with a more central location for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Boy_Scout
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Seattle. When I first pulled up to the hotel in the taxi, I wasn't impressed. However, after staying there the three nights I would definitely stay again when I return to Seattle. The area where the hotel is located is a commercial area and there's a large park about a block away. There is a Holiday Inn Express immediately next to this hotel. I was with several business colleaguges and felt completely safe walking in the area. We walked to downtown (about 20 minutes away), to the space needle (about 15 minutes away) and the restaurants on Lake Union (about 15 minutes away). If it had been dark and I was by myself, I would probably have felt less safe. I had a king size room. The bed was very comfortable, the room had a kitchen area with a sink, microwave and refrigerator. The TV worked fine and there was plenty of hot water. I had faxes sent to me and had no problem getting them. The hotel has free internet. I had difficulty getting on, but called the 800 phone number on the in-room instructions and the technician on the phone got me going. I ate breakfast each morning in the hotel restaurant. The breakfast was very good each morning and more reasonable than most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a few blocks out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: huw2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Seattle for 5 nights for a convention...was pleasantly surprised that it was only a 15 minute walk to the Convention Centre and very close to the Space Needle. Large clean room with good internet access. Ate a couple of times at the Emerald Grill bar - limited menu but ok food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why it is ranked so low on tripadvisor, but this hotel is pretty good! I had pretty low expectations when I entered the hotel, because it was ranked 60-something here. However, when I arrived, it was pleasantly surprised. Looking at previous reviews, there are three main complaints about showers not clearing fast enough, rough neighborhood, noises from hallway. First, the showers worked perfectly, and drained really well. Second, this hotel is NOT in a bad neighborhood, rather it was a pretty safe place. There are so many hotels so close to this one (Holiday Inn Express, Loyal Inn, sixth avenue inn etc) and it is pretty safe. Also, the hotel is really close to the rest of Seattle's main attractions. Walk to Pike Place takes 15 minutes (walking is perfectly fine), because you get to walk across downtown/Westin/Macy/5th avenue and all the exciting places before arriving at your hotel. Noise from hallway can be a problem though. Pros - Free Internet - Helpful Staff - Great rooms and comfortable beds - Clean rooms - Newspaper on morning - Emerald Grill is a nice place - Short elevator waits - Close to main attractions - Attractive prices - Microwave and fridge in room Cons - Somewhat limited food options around the hotel (a 10-minute walk to 5th avenue gives you more food options) - Hallway noise, you can hear footsteps from the hallway on your floor, as well as upstairs. - Not so great views, but who cares - This freeking alarm clock!!! BEWARE!! The first night, the alarm clock rang at 4:37am!!! I was like are you kidding me! Apparently, the alarm clock rings every morning at the same time if you don't turn it off (and it is not so clear how to turn it off!) The largest button on the clock is snooze, so I pushed it because I was half asleep! turns out, it rang again in 15 minutes and so on. Make sure you check your alarm clock before you go to bed each night. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is really nice, comfortable and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the cost”
Reviews.Author: KelownaMustang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn over the Easter weekend. For us it was a very convenient location as we were taking in a couple hockey games at the Key Arena. We drove to Seattle and as we knew the hotel was near the Space Needle it was quite easy to find. The hotel is very close to the Space Needle, Key Arena and fairly close to downtown and the waterfront. Considering the location of the hotel we felt the cost was very reasonable. Our room was fine, it was clean, everything worked, there was a decent sized fridge in the room as well as a microwave. The televisions could be updated although we didn't spend a whole lot of time watching tv. There is quite a bit of construction in the area so if your walking you need to watch out for the odd closed sidewalk etc. We walked to the hockey games both nights and felt safe as there were plenty of people coming and going from the different venues in the area. One odd thing we found with the hotel was the curtains do not close, all you could close were some very thin shears. As we were directly across from another wing of the hotel you could look directly into their rooms so turn the lights out!!!! We had to ask for a map of the area, there were no brochures in the lobby. If your staying at the Holiday Inn do not get it mixed up with the Holiday Inn Express.
